item.title: ActionTimer
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“ownage plz, post:8, topic:118362”]nope 1337 that would only be 3 seconds in real time and what i said for boolean process is correct … the only thing you said that was right is if(delayname >= 30){ Do something } the int would have to be [quote]public int delayname = 0;[/quote]

EDIT: even the thing i said you did right was wrong in a way … why would you want it to do the action if the delay is >= 30 ??? you would want it to be

if(delayname == 0){ Do something }

also in there you would have to add delayname = ##;

and change the #'s to how long you want it to take

#/10 = seconds so 30 = 3 seconds[/quote]

Thanks! <3

Read full topic

item.title: ActionTimer
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

nope 1337 that would only be 3 seconds in real time and what i said for boolean process is correct … the only thing you said that was right is if(delayname >= 30){ Do something } the int would have to be

public int delayname = 0;

EDIT: even the thing i said you did right was wrong in a way … why would you want it to do the action if the delay is >= 30 ??? you would want it to be

if(delayname == 0){ Do something }

also in there you would have to add delayname = ##;

and change the #'s to how long you want it to take

#/10 = seconds so 30 = 3 seconds

Read full topic

item.title: ActionTimer
item.dc:creator: @1337_king 1337 king
item.description:
@1337_king wrote:

To make a new delay:

int delayname = 0

search for boolean process, put this in it:

delayname++;

and where you need the timer, put a code like this:

if(delayname >= 30){
Do something
}
the 30 means 10 seconds in real time.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

wewt took about 10 seconds out of my life to help you quick under public boolean process you have to add if (TIMER > 0) { TIMER -= 1; }

And I’m not really pking so I cant use PkingDelay…

So does anybody know how to make “spellTimer” work? (Its not the real timer I have… Just an example that I’m using so dont say use “PkingDelay” or “ActionTimer”.

-TeleNubby

So does anybody know how to make your own timer?

item.title: ActionTimer
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I know ActionTimer is an actual timer. But where it is called/made (Player.Java) as public int actionTimer = 0;… I made a new one named spellTimer. Then I put it into my spells lets say ice barrage:

if ((spell == ice barrage) && (spellTimer == 0) && (mageLevel >= 0) {
           do spell stuff here;
           spellTimer = 300;  // ---300/10=30seconds
} else if(mageLevel > 0) {
           sendMessage("You do not have 0 mage to cast this spell.");
} else if(spellTimer >= 1) {
           sendMessage("You have to wait 30 seconds before casting a spell again.");
}

But why isnt spellTimer an actual timer? How do you make it so it acts as a timer, not just an int? Because it doesnt countdown for 30 seconds.

So how do I get spellTimer recognized as a timer, not just a variable integer?

Read full topic
